Quiz.Title: Architecture Quiz
Quiz.Description: How familiar are you at architecture?

Questions.QuestionText: Identify the home style shown below.

Answers.Explanation: Close, but not quite. Try again.
Nope, that's not it. Try again.

Questions.QuestionText: The roof shown is known as...

Answers.Explanation: Nope - an A-Frame takes the shape of a letter A, with very steep angles.
Nope. Gambrel roofs are 'barn-shaped', and are usually seen on Dutch Colonial homes.

The hipped roof is often pyramid-shaped, but can take many shapes. The main distinction is the sides of the roof slope from the center down towards the walls, and the area of the home with the hip has no gabel.

Questions.QuestionText: A window over a doorway, is known as...

Answers.Explanation: Not quite, although the window can by an Awning type. Try again!

EndScreen.Message: Architecture is full of weird and unique terms. Learn them all!
